intro: Cranfillia aequabilis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its robust, succulent stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and salty conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, and the flowers can be pink, white, or yellow, depending on the variety. Cranfillia aequabilis plays an important ecological role in the unique flora of Hawaii.
